abstract: A new wave of foreign competitive pressure is beginning to ripple through the United States economy, from companies in Brazil, Russia, India and China.
snippet: A new wave of foreign competitive pressure is beginning to ripple through the United States economy, from companies in Brazil, Russia, India and China.
lead_paragraph: A NEW wave of foreign competitive pressure is beginning to ripple through the United States economy, from companies in emerging markets like Brazil, Russia, India and China. These companies are seeking to become world-spanning multinationals — just as Samsung Electronics emerged from South Korea and Toyota sprang from Japan in earlier phases of globalization.
